content.description: The rate at which water flows out of a pipe, gallons per hour, is given by a differentiable function R of time t. The table above shows the rate as measured every 3 hours for a 24-hour period.
content.question: Is there some time t, 0 < t < 24, such that R'(t) = 0? Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Is there some time t, 0 < t < 24, such that R'(t) = 0? Justify your answer.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
